item.title: Toms of Maine Packaging – Sacrificed
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Disclaimer: This work isn’t by any way commissioned or requested by the company, we just find logos we think need work and fix them. It’s just our sacrifice to the design gods. Please accept it: Design Improvements I love this toothpaste but hate the packaging. This redesign reduces printing costs; three (or even two) color […]

The post Toms of Maine Packaging – Sacrificed appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Disclaimer: This work isn’t by any way commissioned or requested by the company, we just find logos we think need work and fix them. It’s just our sacrifice to the design gods. Please accept it:

Design Improvements

  • I love this toothpaste but hate the packaging. This redesign reduces printing costs; three (or even two) color printing as opposed to what they probably need to do now (cmyk+4 colors).
  • Got rid of the bad clip art photo of mint that’s faded out in the corners in an attempt to make it fit into the design.
  • The new design is cleaner which is particularly important with a toothpaste – Less fonts, less clutter, easier to understand at a glance. And the best part is that if you order it online you will get it fast and safe thanks to the best ProOffice shipping labels.

The post Toms of Maine Packaging – Sacrificed appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Know Me App Logo – Sacrificed
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
As if we don’t have better things to do, we’re now re-designing logos in our free time. This work isn’t by any way commissioned or requested by the company, we just find logos we think need work and fix them. It’s our sacrifice to the design gods. The Know Me app is a good example […]

The post Know Me App Logo – Sacrificed appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
As if we don’t have better things to do, we’re now re-designing logos in our free time. This work isn’t by any way commissioned or requested by the company, we just find logos we think need work and fix them. It’s our sacrifice to the design gods.

The Know Me app is a good example of a forgettable icon, it uses a typical stock smiley as their defining characteristic. We chose to keep the color, get rid of a lot of the noise – opting for flat design – got rid of the drop shadow and other design elements which clutter the icon.

The smile itself is more stylized and has just enough personality to be more distinguishable.

Hope you like it!

The post Know Me App Logo – Sacrificed appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Lindsay Glass
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Lindsay Glass is one of the most established glass companies in Texas, mainly servicing North Texas and Dallas. We updated their online presence (which was very dated) so now they have a site that is as clean and clear as a new pane of glass.

The post Lindsay Glass appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Lindsay Glass is one of the most established glass companies in Texas, mainly servicing North Texas and Dallas. Their online presence was very dated, so we helped them with a re-design – now they have a site that is as clean and clear as a new pane of glass.

The post Lindsay Glass appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: In Progress: Park Slope Civic Council
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
For the last few months we have been working on the redesign of the site for the Park Slope Civic Council, a non-profit organization that is an incredible resource to our community.

The post In Progress: Park Slope Civic Council appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
For the last few months we have been working on the redesign of the site for the Park Slope Civic Council, a non-profit organization that holds this part of Brooklyn together and is an incredible resource to our community.

We worked closely with David Herman Studio on the site, coming up with the right look and feel, and customizing the content management system.

The post In Progress: Park Slope Civic Council appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Re-Launch: Wine Flirt 2.0
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just finished re-designing the WineFlirt site from the ground up. It builds on all the great stuff that the old site had which was mainly their weekly newsletter (now called Scoop) and adds sections for their Wine Club, Happenings, and the Pleasure Panel, a new series of events they'll be hosting.

The post Re-Launch: Wine Flirt 2.0 appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just finished re-designing the WineFlirt site from the ground up. It builds on all the great stuff that the old site had which was mainly their weekly newsletter (now called Scoop) and adds sections for their Wine Club, Happenings, and the Pleasure Panel, a new series of events they’ll be hosting.

The post Re-Launch: Wine Flirt 2.0 appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Cynthia King Dance Studio
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We are excited to be working with one of the most vibrant businesses in Windsor Terrace - Cynthia King Dance Studio is literally down the street from us. We have walked by the studio for years and now we're getting to know all the fun that goes on inside.

The post Cynthia King Dance Studio appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We’re excited to be working with one of the most vibrant businesses in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn – Cynthia King Dance Studio is literally down the street from us. We’ve walked by the studio for years and now we’re getting to know all the fun that goes on inside.

Besides ballet, they offer tap dance, hip hop, toddler dance – you name it. They organize amazing shows and, luckily for us, they have great photography from their performances and students, which is surprisingly hard to find on dance studio websites. Cynthia found out about us through one of her photographers, our friend Amy Way. The new design is going to truly represent this wonderful, energetic studio that has been keeping our neighborhood dancing for the last 8 years.

The post Cynthia King Dance Studio appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: 10 Best Wedding Blogs
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Congratulations to Xochitl and everyone at Always a Blogsmaid, we re-designed their blog last year and it's now featured in the January 2010 issue of Bride's magazine as one of the top 10 Wedding Blogs of 2009.

The post 10 Best Wedding Blogs appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations to Xochitl and everyone at Always a Blogsmaid, we re-designed their blog last year and it’s now featured in the January 2010 issue of Bride’s magazine as one of the top 10 Wedding Blogs of 2009.

item.title: Always a Bridesmaid
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We're re-designing the website for Always a Bridesmaid, it's the second project we're working on for this Manhattan wedding planner A-Team.

The post Always a Bridesmaid appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We love working with this New York (and NJ!) based group of wedding planners!

We just launched Always A Bridesmaid. Xochitl and the team over at AAB have been getting a lot of compliments on the new design, here’s an excerpt from an email she sent us:

I just wanted to thank you! I am getting SOOO much amazing feedback on the new website. My friends, who are always very critical, are just raving and some of the TOP industry consultants have sent me messages on twitter about how great it looks.

The post Always a Bridesmaid appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: the new mimoYmima (v5.0)
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
It's been a long road... We started this re-design at the beginning of the year, and did a lot of the design work in Spain over the Spring. Now it's fall and we're back in Spain and launching the site...

The post the new mimoYmima (v5.0) appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
It’s been a long road… We started this re-design at the beginning of the year, and did a lot of the design work in Spain over the Spring. Now it’s fall and we’re back in Spain and launching the site…

We re-worked all of our existing site’s code into the WordPress system, which we’ve been using as a content management system for clients for years. We’ve been holding out on doing this because we don’t technically need a content management system (we write HTML for a living), but there are a ton of other perks to using WordPress, so we made the switch.

Besides using WordPress, our site has been re-designed to look more impressive on large monitors. Teresa got a 24″ iMac last summer, and seeing how puny the site felt when browsing fullscreen was probably the main reason for the re-design.

Another thing we’ve done is been more selective with our work samples. We added some new projects and got rid of some older ones, please have a look around and let us know what you think by commenting below.

The post the new mimoYmima (v5.0) appeared first on mimoYmima.
